alert.note: Alert for Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton; Upper Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Hunterdon, Warren, southeastern Lehigh, northwestern Bucks, southeastern Monroe and Northampton Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 322 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nazareth to Lehigh University to Zionsville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Forks, Emmaus, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Wilson, Washington, Blairstown, Hellertown, Nazareth, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Bath, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford and Alpha. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 44 and 52. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 59 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 311 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
